reviews.title: Just Right

reviews.text: First - it was a great location for the Jazz festival. Close enough to the free concernts (within two blocks), but far enough away from the scene. The hotel itself is very close (another two blocks) to the train station (VIA RAIL), metro is within a block and the hotel is central to the "underground" (shopping/eating) and numerous, numerous shopping options at the street level (St Catherine street is one of the bordering streets on this square and is a mass mecca of retailers if that's your interest). The popular "Le Bay" department store also is on this block. Few good fast food type restaurants right outside your door - with street side (under tent) seating (in the good weather). Pizza place right next door was great, and very popular with the locals so that gave us a good hint to try it out! Museum mile is also within a few blocks - so as said - this location is very accessible to a lot of what the inner city offers.

reviews.text: Hotel itself , as said many times in previous reviews, is built for a family. Rooms/suites are enormous. We stayed in a King Studio (only two of us) which is the smallest accomodation and with the kitchen table and full kitchen area it was very, very spacious. Our room was extremely clean, all amenities, kitchen ware, glassware, plates, everything you would need to cook in was spotless and plentiful. Good size bathroom, spacious and clean. Very updated. Plenty of dresser space, closet space. Large windows (we overlooked the square). New flat screen TV (large) and bedding was comfortable. For an extended stay, this place is ideal! Hotel itself (our floor) was quiet and the continental breakfast was the usual - but plentiful (toast, bagels, criossants, cereal, waffles, fresh fruit, juices and coffee & tea). No complaints at all. Staff was very nice and helpful in our contacts with them (check-in, taxi service and baggage service).

reviews.text: Just completing 3 nites at Le Square Phillips. This is second stay at LSP and it continues to impress at every level. Location is terrific - a few blocks either way to the Orange or the Green Metro lines - or just enter the underground Montreal tunnel network, also close by. As a recycled warehouse building it appeals in many ways - including high ceilings and rooms with generous floor plans. Service is just right for me: quiet, modest efficient - and enough. Breakfast is continental and plentiful. Internet is available for my laptop - or in the "business center" on the hotels computers. Got snowed in this weekend - and the front desk was very helpful and accommodating. Overall I would say this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at - without slipping into the too many stars decadence that money can buy (if that appeals to you!).
reviews.title: Still the Best

reviews.text: We visited with our 11 and 5yo boys. The rooms was just immense. We stayed in a suite with one queen and one double (sleeper sofa). The room had an eat-in kitchen and walk-in closet. The hotel was clean and the staff was mostly friendly. The rooftop pool was nice, clean yet small. It cost us around $160/night before taxes. Parking was expensive at around $30/night (valet only). There were lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, and it was a quick walk to the Old Montreal area (mostly downhill). We'd stay there again in a second!
reviews.title: Simply parfait!

reviews.text: We hadn't heard of Le Square Phillips before we decided to stay 3 nights there two weeks ago. During our one previous visit to Montreal, we were at the W Hotel in Victoria Square. We were glad to be at Le Square Phillips this time around. While the W was plush and heavenly, Le Square Phillips was much more practical and better situated, and had some of the best service of any hotel we'd stayed in before. The suite we were at was also the most generously sized suite we'd even been in. The kitchen was well-stocked and allowed us to dine in, keeping food costs down. (Besides, produce in Montreal is amazing, and we were glad to have been able to sample it in the comforts of our hotel room. A salad and some smoked meat and good bread from one of the many bakeries-- yum!) The free breakfast was continental, but great to start the day with, and the pool was small but well-kept, and long enough to get a proper lap swim in. And it was nice to have free wi-fi, as we had to do some work while we were away. We highly recommend this hotel for families, and for anyone staying long-term.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, with a roof top pool

reviews.text: This hotel was by far the nicest we stayed at on our road trip, if we ever went back to Montreal this is the place I would stay. I can't speak about any other hotels in Montreal but this one deserves a high rating. Nice friendly staff, great rooms, nice breakfast on the second floor. loved the pool on the roof with a great view of downtown Montreal. within walking distance of many attractions.
reviews.title: Felt like our own apartment

reviews.text: My husband, son, daughter, mother-in-law and I stayed for about a week at Le Square Phillips Hotel in July 2007 around the time of the annual Montreal Jazz Festival. It ended up being the perfect locale for the festival, which took place just a few blocks away mostly at the Place des Arts. We rented a two-bedroom suite - which was immense! There was a large kitchen, with full-size fridge, full stove/oven, microwave, dining area with six chairs, and a huge living room with beautiful view of Phillips Square. One of the bedrooms even had a walk-in closet. The service was superb, and the downtown location was convenient to metro stops and many restaurants. There's even a La Baie department store down the street.

reviews.text: I have lived in montreal for 14 years, I have stayed at numerous hotels downtown after a night of partying. The Square Phillips hotel & suites has by far exceeded my expectations and then some. After booking online (very convinient) for my girlfriend's birthday, i needed some information regarding the reservation and check-in procedures. They were very helpful and prompt with their responses and knew what they were doing. The room i had which was the family suite, upon entering left me speechless. The shear size of the room was beyond anything i've ever experienced at any hotel. The two bedrooms, kitchen and extremely large bathroom, made me feel right at home. The two bedrooms themselves were the size of a regular room at your local super 8. The kitchen, complete with stove, dishwasher, microwave, full size refridgerator, utensils, glasses and plates was quite spacious with a 6 seat table. The cleanliness was far beyond any hotel i have ever stayed in. The staff was amazing, prompt and courteous. I have never felt more welcome and valued as a customer at any other hotel. I would definately recommend to anyone coming in from out of town to experience life in montreal. It is in a prime location, 2 blocks from all major stores and a block away from underground shopping. I truely loved my stay and would never think twice about staying here again. It was truely an experience that i shall never forget.
reviews.title: HUGE room, great price

likes.liked: — huge room, reasonable price, pleasant breakfast

reviews.text: This is my new home-away-from-home in Montreal. The rooms are unbelievable. We had the studio with 2 double beds for 3 of us (mom & 2 teen daughters), which was perfect. The rooms are huge – tons of closet space – a very well appointed bathroom with a nice deep tub - a full kitchen (fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, dishes, glasses, etc) and lots and lots of floor space so you don’t feel crowded. The beds are very comfortable, they have brand new LG TV’s and the internet is free. On top of all that, there is a great continental breakfast included in your room rate. The rooftop terrace is beautiful, and the pool (also on the roof) is pretty good for a hotel pool.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous Location

reviews.text: The hotel is right downtown, between Ste-Catherine and Boulevard René-Lévesque, and within walking distance to almost everything – the central train station – shopping on Ste-Catherine – Old Montréal. reviews.text: This isn’t a five star hotel, but it has some nice features. They have a small, but nice rooftop pool. They have a very clean laundry facility with three washers and three dryers. The concierge was very helpful and thoroughly answered all of our questions. The location is central and within walking distance to the train station. While the free breakfast isn’t elaborate, it is sufficient and convenient.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in great location in Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in Le Square Phillips Hotel and it exceeded our expectations. It was a lovely modern smaller hotel in a very nice, quiet, location in central Montreal. Our room was exceptionally large and beautifully fitted-out with a full kitchen - basically a full studio apartment. Reception staff were very friendly and efficient. The hotel has an excellent business centre with free internet access and printers, etc. No complaints at all. Excellent value for the price.
reviews.title: Great location and a good hotel especially for a family

reviews.title: Very good location, value and concierge

reviews.text: The hotel is presumably a converted office building and our room was very large, well equipped (including a full kitchen) but rather spartan in its decoration. This is not a particularly charming hotel but would be an excellent choice for a family given the size of the rooms, the ability to cook some meals and the complimentary continental breakfast that is provided. The breakfast is certainly adequate but on a couple of mornings we had to brave quite a melee to actually get the food from the functional cafeteria style breakfast room. In the end we found it best to pick up a selection and take it back to the room.
reviews.title: Trip Advisor was right
